alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:22PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Additional rainfall from today and into Friday will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to encroach on roads along the East Bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 830 PM CDT Thursday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 04/07/1943. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
